turns.utterance: What is your favorite number? Mine is the number 7
turns.response: I like 7, seems pretty cool. I mean it comes after 6 and before 8.

turns.utterance: I just remembered a joke from when I was a Kid. "Why was 6 afraid of 7?'
turns.response: Yeah I have heard that, funny. Long ago 7 was written in a curve so it looked like a J.

turns.utterance: Really? I didn't know that. Why was it changed from the curved J to the 7 it is today?
turns.response: That is just how they wrote. The western Ghubar Arabs' made it more diagonal than straight to kind of differentiate it.

turns.utterance: I guess that would make sense.
turns.response: The Cham and Khmer glyph for 7 also made their number look like a one, but so different so they were not confused.

turns.utterance: So, basically every different culture had there own way of writting the number 7. When was it made official in the English version to what it is today?
